dcterms:creator: G. B. Moody
R. G. Mark
dcterms:description: The MIT-BIH Arrhythmia dataset contains 48 half-hours of two-channel ambulatory ECG recordings, digitized at 360 samples per second, obtained from 47 subjects. It is widely used for evaluating algorithms for arrhythmia detection.
dcterms:title: MIT-BIH Arrhythmia Dataset

dcterms:creator: I. Silva
G. B. Moody
L. Celi
dcterms:description: The PhysioNet/CinC (PICC) 2011 Challenge dataset consists of standard 12-lead ECG signals recorded simultaneously for 10 seconds, each lead sampled at 500 Hz. It is used to improve the quality of ECGs collected using mobile phones.
dcterms:title: PhysioNet/CinC (PICC) 2011 Challenge

dcterms:creator: S.D. Greenwald
dcterms:description: The MIT-BIH Supraventricular Arrhythmia Database includes 78 half-hour ECG recordings digitized at 120 Hz. It is used for improved detection and classification of arrhythmias in noise-corrupted electrocardiograms.
dcterms:title: MIT-BIH Supraventricular Arrhythmia Database
